lines.text:
[to machine on wall after finding out that they no longer use toilet paper]
Thanks a lot you shit-brained, fuck-faced, ball breaking, duck fucking pain in the ass.
John Spartan, you are fined five credits for repeated violations of the verbal morality statute.

[grabbing the tickets]
So much for the seashells. See you in a few minutes.
Send a maniac to catch one.
We're police officers! We're not trained to handle this kind of violence!

[to John Spartan]
How can you justify destroying a $7 million dollar mini mall to rescue a girl whose ransom was only $25,000 dollars?
FUCK YOU, LADY!
Ha! Good answer!
Mellow greetings. What seems to be your boggle?
[last lines]
But there's just one thing I wanna know...
Hm?
How's that damn three seashell thing work?
[the voice-activated car that Spartan is riding in is malfunctioning]
Brake! Brake! Brake now, you Mickey Mouse-piece of shit!
Bad aim, Blondie!
Spartan? John Spartan? Aw shit, they let anybody into this century! What the hell you doing here?
Is it cold in here, or is it just me?
Good memory.
I have, in fact, perused some newsreels in the Schwarzenegger Library, and the time that you took that car...
Hold it. The Schwarzenegger Library?
Yes. The Schwarzenegger Presidential Library. Wasn't he an actor when you...?
Stop! He was President?
Yes! Even though he was not born in this country, his popularity at the time caused the 61st Amendment which states...
I don't wanna know. President...
You're gonna regret this the rest of your life... both seconds of it.
Simon says, "Die."
radio jingles]
Somebody put me back in the fridge.

[whispering to Lenina]
Look, I don't know if you guys know it, but uh... you're out of toilet paper.

[confused]
Did... did you say toilet *paper*?
Um... they used handfuls of wadded paper back in the 20th...
[Lenina, Alfredo, and Erwin all laugh]
I'm happy that you're happy, but the place where you're supposed to have the toilet paper, you've got this little shelf with three seashells on it.
He doesn't know how to use the three seashells!
[Erwin continues to laugh, then calms down]
I can see how that could be confusing.
[after futuristic, contact-free "sex"]
Look, Huxley, why don't we just do it the old-fashioned way?

[stands up, shocked]
Eeewww, disgusting! You mean... *fluid transfer*?
Hey Luke Skywalker, use the force.
I don't know... lately I just don't feel like there's anything special about me.
You are an incredibly sensitive man, who inspires joy-joy feelings in all those around you.
The Armory exhibit is now sealed. All museum patrons still occupying the facility should remain calm. Help is imminent.
[the sealed Armory door is blown apart by a canon]
The museum is no longer sealed, is it? Ha-ha! What can I say, I'm a blast from the past!
You should've stayed there.
Oh boy, that voice sounds familiar. Who is that?
[opens fire]
What you're telling me to do is violate a direct order. I'm supposed to take you back to the Cryo Prison.
Listen, Huxley. I just know okay. I'm gonna find Phoenix and I'm gonna put him on ice or that's where *I'm* gonna be. After that, I'm gonna turn all of my attention to that fuckin' Cacteau.
Enhance your calm, John Spartan.
Look, I'm tired of enhancing my calm.

[Seeing Spartan opening the pod to the depths of wasteland]
Wait, you're opening the pod to the depths of wasteland?
You don't give a shit about. Now, I'm going to find Phoenix and I'm gonna put him in a hurt locker. So, are you coming with me, or are you gonna arrest me?
Okay. Let's go blow this guy.

[Annoyed]
Away. Blow this guy *away*?
Whatever.
I was wondering if you would like to have sex?

[surprised]
Here? With you? Now?

[nervously, nodding]
Mm-hmm.
Oh yeah.
Wait a minute, this is the future. Where are all the phaser guns?
Simon says, "Bleed."
No, John Spartan, you do not accuse the savior of our city of being in league with a multi-murder-death-killer like Simon Phoenix! It's... rude!
I'll be subtle. I'm good at subtle.
John Spartan, this display of barbaric behavior was unacceptable even in your time!
Yeah. But it worked.
[Shoots out the monitors with Cocteau's face on them]
When a man like Pheonix has a gun to your head, ten seconds is nine and a half seconds longer than you live.
[John Spartan landed on the police car stolen by Simon Phoenix]
No free rides!

[shoots a CyroCon about to knife Spartan]
That man has died by my hands.
It was him or us, Huxley.
Well yeah, there is that.

[Spartan encounters a burger grill in the underground world]
Just don't ask them where the meat comes from.
Huxley, what's that supposed to mean?
Do you see any cows around here, detective?
Que es este carne?
[What is this meat?]
Este carne es de rata.
[This meat is from rats]
Rat? This is a rat burger?
[vendor nods]
Not bad! Matter of fact this is the best burger I've had in years!
Gracias, Senor.
Prego. See ya later.
Be well!
Be fucked.
John Spartan, this display of barbaric behavior was unacceptable even in your time!
Yeah. But it worked.
[Shooting]
When a man like Simon Pheonix pionts a gun at your head, 10 seconds is 9 1/2 seconds longer than you live.

Dammit, Spartan. I'm sick and tired of this "Demolition Man" shit! You're not supposed to come down here, you're not supposed to apprehend Simon Phoenix single-handedly, and you're not supposed to blow anything up!
It wasn't me this time, he dumped the gas and had the placed rigged to blow.

Yeah right, and you had nothing to do with it. I know you've been trying to nail this psycho for 2 years. But try to remember a little thing like official police procedure. Now where are the hostages?
They're not here.
What do mean they're not here, are you sure?
Because I did a thermo check. They're only 8 people, all a part of his gang.

[Being arrested]
Wrong again.
Do you have something to say, scum bag?

[to officer apprehending Phoenix]
Get him out of here.
[to Spartan]
You and I are gonna have a nice long chat.

[Coming in]
Captain. Captain.
What.
We've checked the building. There's bodies everywhere, there has to be about 20 or 30, they're everywhere.
[Spartan looks in disbelief]
See Captain. I told him, he said he didn't care.
[Spartan charges at Phoenix but is restrained by his fellow officers]
Oh shit, I can't believe that you gave up 30 hostages for little old me. We're gonna have a nice time together. See ya' sweetie. Honey! Sugar!
Hope you called your lawyer, because you're gonna need him.
You got big balls coming down here, cop after the kind of show *you* put on.
We are looking for a murder-death-killer. Are you gonna help us or bully us with your primitive weapons?
[Friendly then raises his twin barrelled pistol and fires it to show it's not primitive]
Oh, maybe they're not so primitive.

So, you think you're taking me in huh? Guess what, not happening. Yeah, you can tell Cacteau he can kiss my ass. That's right, tell him that it's gonna take a whole *army* of assholes to get rid of me 'cause I don't give a shit, I've got nothing to lose.
Hey, I don't wanna rain on your parade, pal. But, i don't know who the hell you think you are or who's gonna take you anywhere. So stay here, be well and Cacteau's an asshole!
[In anger, he slaps a scrap who drops his weapon]
No, he must be lying. They're only down here to spy on us.
Wait a minute, *you're* that guy outside Taco Bell.
Yeah. What do you want?
I guess you're not a part of the *Cacteau Plan* are you?
What? Greed, deception, abuse of power? That's no plan.
That's why everybody's down here?
come down here, maybe starve to death.
Why don't you take charge and lead these people out of here?
I'm no leader. I do what I have to do. Sometimes, people come with me. All I want to do is bury Cacteau up to his neck in shit and make him think happy, happy thoughts forever.
Well, I got bad news. *I* think he wants to *kill* you.
[Freindly gives him a blank look]
You're on TV!
Do you have anything new to say on your behalf?
Yeah, I do. Teddy Bear!
Simon Phoenix is an old fashioned criminal. We need an old fashioned cop.
Gun. Noun. Portable firearm. This device was widely utilized in the urban wars of the late twentieth century. Referred to as a pistol, a piece...
Look I don't need a history lesson! C'mon, HAL, where are the god damn guns?
You are fined one credit for a violation of the Verbal Morality Statute.
What? Fuck you!
Your repeated violation of the Verbal Morality Statute has caused me to notify the San Angeles Police Department. Please remain where you are for your reprimand.
Yeah, right.
[police sirens approach]
Fuckers are fast too.
You are fined one credit for a violation of the Verbal Morality Statute.
Chief, you can take this job, and you can shovel it.
Take this job... and shovel it.
Yeah?
Close enough.
He's finally matched his meet. You really licked his ass.
That's *met* his match and kicked... *kicked* his ass...
The exchange of bodily fluids, do you know what that leads to?
Yeah, I do! Kids, smoking, a desire to raid the fridge.

[sotto voce]
Sanctimonious asshole.
Lenina Huxley, you are fined one-half credit for a sotto voce violation of the Verbal Morality Statute.
What would you say if I called you a brutish fossil, symbolic of a decayed era gratefully forgotten?
I don't know... thanks?
Why don't you just shove a leash up my ass?
Ah, smoking is not good for you, and it's been deemed that anything not good for you is bad; hence, illegal. Alcohol, caffeine, contact sports, meat...
Are you shitting me?
John Spartan, you are fined one credit for a violation of the Verbal Morality Statute.
What the hell is that?
John Spartan, you are fined one credit for a violation of the Verbal Morality Statute.
Bad language, chocolate, gasoline, uneducational toys and anything spicy. Abortion is also illegal, but then again so is pregnancy if you don't have a licence.

[checking the charge status of his futuristic plasma rifle]
C'mon you space-age piece of shit!
Look, I'm sorry I yelled at you back there.

No need to make a de-hurtful retraction. I've just assimilated too much contraband. I fleshed you out as some blow-up-the-bad-guy-with-a-happy-grin-he-man type, but now I realize that you're the moody-troubled-past-gunslinger-who-only-draws-when-he-must type.
Huxley, stop.
What?
I'm not any of that. I just do my job and things get...
Get demolished.
[after Spartan crashes in a police car]
Look at you, you're a shambles!
Don't worry, I can fix it. All I need is a needle and thread.
[pause]
I really didn't say that, did I? Damn!
I'm gonna go down there, I'm gonna find Phoenix, and I'm gonna put him in a hurt locker.
Phoenix is an old fashioned criminal. We need an old fashioned cop.

[referring to Phoenix]
They thawed this guy out just to kill me? I'm flattered.
Don't be flattered, be frightened. This guy's a certifiable nightmare.
Thank you for rendering me unconscious.
Huxley, I did it for your own good.
We're supposed to be a team.
We are.
[grabs Huxley, dips, and tongue-kisses her]

[shocked, but impressed]
Oh, my. Are all bodily fluid transfers like this?
Better.
Better? Oh, my.
[Huxley kisses Spartan]
I think I'm gonna like the future.

[stamping her foot]
You are a savage creature John Spartan, and I wish for you to leave my domicile now!
Huxley, look, this isn't the Wild West! The Wild West wasn't even the Wild West! Hurting people's not a good thing! Sometimes it is,
[turns to Cocteau]
but not when it's a bunch of people looking for something to eat!
Looks like there's a new shepherd in town.
[Spartan gives her an exasperated look]
That's sheriff.
I find this lack of stimulus to be truly disappointing, don't you think?
I try not to, my dear. However, you're young, think all you want!
[Huge Explosion, John Spartan steps from the wreckage]
I'll be god damned! Like a New York cockroach!
I must've done something right in a previous life. Can't imagine what that could've been.
[a frozen naked criminal swings by overhead]
I hope my butt didn't look like that! Okay, who do we have left that's good? Wilkes, Patrick... Jeffrey Dahmer? I love that guy!
So let me get this right, they defrosted you just so you could lasso my piddly ass? Damn, you been had! I been dreamin' about killin' you for forty years.
Well, keep dreaming!
Well I must say that whacking, whatever it is, sounds most disagreeable.
You're under arrest, Phoenix.
Arrest? Shit. And you're trespassing.
Simon Phoenix! Lie down with your hands behind your back.
What's this? Six of you. Such nice, tidy uniforms. Oh I'm so scared!
[the Police Officers look at each other]
What you guys don't have sarcasm anymore?
[Police Officer talks to his automated assistant]
Maniac has responded with a scornful remark.
Approach, and repeat ultimatum in an even firmer tone of voice. Add the words, "or else".
We can just wait for another code to go red. And when Phoenix performs another Murder Death Kill, we'll know exactly where to pounce.

[sarcastic]
Great plan.

[not realising the sarcasm]
Thank you.
He likes your plan, Chief!

[after his gang kills Dr. Cocteau]
Put another log on the fire!
[the gang throws Cocteau into the fireplace]

[commenting on his cryo-prison conditioning program]
I'm a seamstress? - That's great. I come out of cryo-prison and I'm Betsy-fucking-Ross...
[Simon goes to a computer terminal and is surprised to find his fingers flying across the keys with ease]
Damn, I'm possessed! Wonder if I can play the accordion too...

[complementing Spartan]
You are even better live than on Laserdisc!
I thought your life force had been prematurely terminated!
Yeah, I thought I was history too. What the hell happened? All of a sudden, this car turned into a cannoli.
[Simon's museum piece "ray gun" beeps ready]
It's about time! The past is over, John! Time for something new and improved!
Aw, hell...
[he leaps out of the way as Simon fires an energy blast from the rifle, blowing a hydrant apart]
Holy shit! I love this gun!
an evil Mr. Rogers!
[Spartan and Huxley enter and see Cocteau's face speaking to them from dozens of monitors]
Forgive my lack of bodily disposition, but I do have an entire city government to run.
you programmed Phoenix's rehabilitation program to turn him into a terrorist, and I don't think his escape was an accident either!
Very subtle.
Thank you.
[after Spartan crashes in a police car]
Look at you, you're in shambles!
Don't worry, I can fix it. All I need is a needle and thread.
[pause]
I really didn't say that, did I? Damn!
[John Spartan is about to bungee jump from a helicopter]
Send a maniac to catch one.
See, I told the city, I said "Look, nobody comes down here." Postmen figured it out. Policemen figured it out. But the goddamned bus drivers just wouldn't listen.
You're dead, Spartan!
You forgot to say Simon Says.
Is it cold in here, or is it just me?

You know, I keep looking around and I think about my daughter growing up in a place like this and I'm afraid she's gonna think I'm some kind of primitive. That I mean, as much as I wanna see her, I almost don't want to 'cause I wouldn't fit into the picture very well. Not very well at all.
Thanks a lot you shit brained, fuck faced, ball bearing, duck fucking pain in the ass.
shhhhhhhhhh

[Grabbing the fines from the the statute machine to use as toilet paper]
hmm-hmm, so much for the seashells. See you in a couple of minutes.
You have apprehended the villain responsible for the murder of our beloved Dr. Raymond Cocteau?
Well, I wouldn't exactly say apprehended. Let's just say he's history. And the Cryo-prison? That's history, too.
[Chief Earle looks upon the damaged cryo-prison in disbelief]

[confused; takes off his glasses]
What will we do? How will we live?
I tell you what we're do. We're all gonna go out drinking, get shit-faced, and paint the town, literally. I mean graffiti, slogans. It'll be a blast.

[to Chief Earle]
Why don't you get a little dirty?

[to Edgar]
You a lot clean.
And somewhere in the middle... I don't know. You'll figure it out.
Fuckin' A!

[impressed]
Well put.

[to Garcia]
We'll look at you. You get a bump on the noggin, and you think you're Pancho Villa?

[Garcia looks confused]
Who?

[Spartan shaking his head]
Never mind.

[to Spartan]
Time to take a stand pal.

[to Edgar]
Well good. While you're doing that, loan me a gun.
[Edgar hands Spartan a gun]
Loan me two guns.
[Wastelander hands Spartan a waste belt with a gun in it. Spartan puts the belt over his shoulder]

[to Edgar and Wastelanders]
You'de use the weapons of mass destruction against men and women who uphold the law?

[to Chief]
We use these to shop for groceries.
